p: Ningaloo Marine Park ( Fig 1), in Western Australia, is a well-established MPA and UNESCO World Heritage Site with relatively few ecosystem threats in comparison with other coral reefs [ 50, 51]. Following a recent severe ocean warming event which resulted in significant coral bleaching [ 36, 52â€“ 54], rising sea surface temperatures (SSTs) associated with climate change are expected to present the greatest threat to this ecosystem. However, the existing management plan does not explicitly consider climate change.
